alert.note: Alert for Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 3:44PM CST until December 14 at 7:30PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following counties and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, Orleans and St. Tammany. In southern Mississippi, Hancock and Pearl River. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 344 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Slidell, Picayune, Pearl River, Lacombe, Stennis Space Center, Pearlington and Slidell Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
